Job Title: BAS Controls Channel Account Manager

Location: Greater Houston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
At Johnson Controls, our employees are the most important part of our business. Thank you for your interest in Johnson Controls!

Build your best future with the Johnson Controls team!

As a global leader in smart, healthy and sustainable buildings, our mission is to reimagine the performance of buildings to serve people, places and the plant. Join a winning team that enables you to build your best future! Our teams are uniquely positions to support a multitude of industries across the global. You'll have the opportunity to develop yourself through significant work projects and learning opportunities. We strive to provide our employees with an experience focused on supporting their physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Become a member of our team and family, and thrive in an empowering company culture where your voice and ideas are heard - your next great opportunity is just a few clicks away!

What We Offer

Competitive salaryPaid vacation/holidays/sicktime - 3 week of vacation the first yearComprehensive benefits packageExtensive product and on the job cross-trainingOurstanding resources and collaborative team environmentDedication to safety through our Zero Harm policy

What You Will Do

The BAS Controls Channel Account Manager will grow product revenue and margin volume and meeting set sales plans and objectives through the Building Solutions North America (BSNA) channel. Get ready to sell the complete Johnson Controls product portfolio with focus on the innovative Metasys building automation system.

You will use and promote the use of the sales process to help cultivate and lead long term relationships to seek out new sales opportunities. You will represent the Global Products (GP) product and technology offerings during the sales process to the BSNA channel and end customer, as well as work with the channel to deploy new product offerings and ensures they're trained on the products, features, value proposition, and pricing.

You will also deliver the products revenue and margin plans for assigned BSNA channel accounts and establish and sustain important internal/external relationships.

This position is a remote position; however, you must be located in the Dallas, TX, or Fort Worth, TX, area and be prepared for up to 50% domestic travel.

How You Will Do It

Selling, supporting and servicing customers within their aligned accounts to drive product revenue and margin results and provide customer support on JCI's Building Control products, features, value proposition, pricing and material.Partner with key and targeted customers to reach optimal sales goals.Recommend product solutions.Leverage JCI product offerings form competitors based on the total benefit of doing business with Johnson Controls.Customer voice and identifies concerns.Using Playbooks and assigned accounts to conduct quarterly strategic account review sessions. Makes sure customers execute appropriate actions towards the co-developed sales plans to achieve the sales goals and objectives.Work and communicate with key stakeholders (Branch GM, Sales Management, Account Executives, Project Managers, Lead System Specialists, System Operations Specialist.Support project teams, pre-bid strategy, scope review and expansion of offerings.Influencing and change management.Responsible for top-line growth of revenue and margin within your accounts. Supports BSNA channel in meeting growth objectives around gross margin and segment income by analyzing the market and current performance.Provides accurate forecasting around monthly sales and communicate any sales support that's needed.Developing annual volume and growth objectives for assigned accounts.Active involvement in regional or local industry associations such as ASHRAE, HARDI, ARI, CGNA, etc. and actively participate in tradeshows.Works with Product Management and Engineering to provide feedback on product features and enhancements for customers.Provides competitive analysis of the local market and obtains technical assistance when needed, as well as technical expertise, sales assistance, and market development.

What we look for

Required

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business or Marketing6+ years of progressive, direct sales experience preferably in HVAC/Controls or a related industryExcellent presentation skillsAble to travel 50%

Johnson Controls International plc. is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a qualified individual with a disability or any other characteristic protected by law. To view more information about your equal opportunity and non-discrimination rights as a candidate, visit EEO is the Law. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please visit here.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
